intro: Ilex philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Its foliage is evergreen, providing year-round coverage, and it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Ilex philippinensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
